intro: Clidemia capitellata, commonly known as the coral vine, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or vine, often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a waxy texture, while its flowers are borne in terminal clusters. Clidemia capitellata is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value but can be invasive in certain regions.
